prompt: How well do you know about algebraic manipulation of equations (rearranging formulas, solving linear equations, proportional reasoning)?
How well do you know about interpreting and analyzing graphs (reading slopes, areas, and trends)?
How well do you know about basic derivatives (rates of change, rules for polynomials/exponentials, chain/product rules)?
How well do you know about basic integrals (areas under curves, definite integrals, simple u-substitution)?
How well do you know about exponentials and logarithms (ln, log10) and their properties?
How well do you know about SI units, unit conversions, and dimensional analysis?
How well do you know about basic mechanics concepts: work, energy, power, and conservation of energy?
How well do you know about temperature, pressure, volume, density, and converting temperature scales (Celsiusâ€“Kelvin)?
How well do you know about the ideal gas law (PV = nRT), moles, and using gas constants?
How well do you operate a scientific calculator (scientific notation, exponents/logs, parentheses, memory functions)?
How long do you want to take a session without any break? (e.g., 25 min, 45 min)
How would you like to understand the concept? (e.g., visual explanations, worked examples, problem sets)
Do you have any accessibility needs?
What best describes your learning context?
